title: Billing API Routes
description:
Create REST API Endpoints for Claims Management and Billing Operations

Implement a comprehensive set of RESTful API endpoints to handle claim lifecycle management and billing-related operations.

Requirements:

Claims Management Endpoints:
- POST /api/claims - Create new claim with validation
- GET /api/claims - List claims with pagination, filtering, and sorting
- GET /api/claims/:id - Retrieve single claim details
- PUT /api/claims/:id - Update existing claim information
- PATCH /api/claims/:id/status - Update claim status (draft, submitted, approved, rejected, paid)
- DELETE /api/claims/:id - Soft delete or archive claim

Billing Operations Endpoints:
- POST /api/billing/invoices - Generate invoice from approved claim(s)
- GET /api/billing/invoices - List invoices with filters (status, date range, amount)
- GET /api/billing/invoices/:id - Retrieve invoice details
- POST /api/billing/payments - Record payment against invoice
- GET /api/billing/payments - List payment history
- GET /api/billing/statements - Generate billing statements for reporting

Technical Considerations:
- Implement proper HTTP status codes (200, 201, 400, 401, 404, 500)
- Add request validation and sanitization
- Include authentication and authorization middleware
- Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse
- Add comprehensive error handling with meaningful messages
- Support JSON request/response format
- Include API versioning strategy (e.g., /api/v1/)

Data Validation:
- Validate required fields for claims (claimant info, amount, date, type)
- Ensure amount values are positive numbers with proper decimal handling
- Validate date formats and logical date ranges
- Check for duplicate claim submissions
- Verify claim status transitions are valid

Testing Requirements:
- Unit tests for each endpoint
- Integration tests for complete workflows
- Test error scenarios and edge cases
- Validate authorization rules are enforced

Documentation:
- API endpoint documentation with request/response examples
- Error code reference
- Authentication requirements per endpoint
